Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by Rabbi Gerald Sussman, Temple Emmanuel, 984 Post Avenue, Staten Island, New York 10302.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Rose.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Council Member Fernando Cabrera at today's Meeting.

Council Member Rose moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Ignizio moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 21, 2011 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Lander:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Sections 20-226 or 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 210 Prospect Park Ave., Council District no. 39 Application no. 20125018 TCK, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 210 Prospect Park West, Brooklyn (20125018 TCK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Recchia
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 100469 MMK , a change to the city map, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Amendment of the City Map (C 100469 MMK)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting and posting online information pertaining to mobile food vendors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Reporting and posting online information pertaining to mobile food vendors.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Senate to approve and President Barack Obama to ratify the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights (ICESCR) and the Optional Protocol to the ICESCR upon signature, with all due speed.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights (ICESCR)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Bloomberg Administration to eliminate all forms of three-quarter housing, including referrals made by City agencies.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Bloomberg Administration to eliminate all forms of three-quarter housing, including referrals made by City agencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of consumer affairs to post and maintain renderings or drawings for approved sidewalk cafés on the department’s website.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of consumer affairs to post and maintain renderings or drawings for approved sidewalk cafés on the department’s website.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the city to assume responsibility for cleaning sidewalks that abut certain retaining walls.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring the city to assume responsibility for cleaning sidewalks that abut certain retaining walls.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to studying the feasibility of developing geothermal energy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Studying the feasibility of developing geothermal energy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting a taxicab from soliciting or accepting passengers with their off duty light engaged.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting a taxicab from soliciting or accepting passengers with their off duty light engaged.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the U.S. House of Representatives and the U.S. Senate to pass H.R. 1879 and S.980 entitled “The United States Ferry System Investment Act,” which would increase funding to the federal Ferry Boat Discretionary Grant Program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Pass “The United States Ferry System Investment Act”  (H.R. 1879 and S. 980)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on finger imaging of food stamp applicants.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Reporting on finger imaging of food stamp applicants.

Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie)
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Dr. Susan Klitzman to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her reappointment to the Board of Health, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 553 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
